text: when President Obama signed the
Affordable Care Act in March 2010 he
said but since then Obamacare has been
plagued by an imperfect rollout and
technical glitches the White House
originally hoped that 7 million people
would sign up for health care before the
upcoming deadline on March 31st they
revised that number down to 6 million
when problems with the website made it
hard for people to sign up things have
improved and now the total enrolled has
reached 5 million but how do people feel
about Obamacare now four years after the
law was signed according to the Pew
Research Center less than half of
Americans approve of the law that number
isn't very different from the 2010
figure but take a look at this the
number that disapprove of the law has
risen from 44 percent then to 53 percent
today and broken promises aren't helping
the president's message
those with a negative view really hate
it
signing up healthy young people for
insurance is key to the health care
system success and pew found that half
of them support the law compared to only
35% of people over 65 on the other hand
people with no college education are
less likely to approve of the law than
college graduates with the enrollment
deadline looming and the battle over
health care heating up again in the
midterm elections the Obama
administration has stepped up its PR
campaign but is anybody listening less
than a quarter of Americans say they're
following health care news very closely
